key_risks: Regulatory risks due to operating in a highly regulated industry, particularly in China
Credit risk from borrower defaults, especially in volatile economic conditions
Reputation and ethical concerns related to high interest rates and predatory lending practices
Data security and privacy risks due to reliance on big data and AI
controversies: Criticism for high interest rates and predatory lending practices
Association with 'rent-a-bank' schemes to evade state interest rate caps
social_issues: Ethical concerns over lending practices and potential harm to borrowers
governance_issues: Regulatory compliance challenges and adaptation to changing regulations

sources.title: These 4 Utah Banks Are 'Exporting Predatory Lending' Across America
sources.snippet: Most -- but not all -- U.S. states cap lending rates to protect consumers. "Rent-a-bank" loans let lenders avoid these rules. Some lenders are charging APYs of as much as 200% on consumer loans.

sources.title: Utah Banks targeted for laundering predatory loans - ABC4 Utah
sources.snippet: In a rent-a-bank scheme, a company that isn't a bank runs a lending program and takes most of the profit, that a bank nominally approves and intitally funds- placing its name on the loans. This arrangement helps the true lender (the nonbank company) evade state interest rate limits, which does not apply to banks."
